result.execSummary:
The defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all of following by end of supervision.   Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under SEc. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision..  All applicable fees of supervision.  Bail to apply.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  **3/15/2016  Honorable Timothy M. Witkowiak-credit amended to 78 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
No alcohol or drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
Follow all rules of supervision. Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment. Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; and that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Darrin Joseph Jarentowski

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Signed and filed:  Order on Sentence Credit.

THEREFORE, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction is amended to reflect 78 days of sentence credit.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  spc
Defendant's letter in support of sentence credit with revocation order and warrant attached.
Letter to defendant seeking copy of revocation order and warrant in former case for determination of sentence credit in this case.
Defendant's pro se request for additional sentence credit.

Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  2 YEARS 6 MONTHS with 17 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEARS 6 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 YEAR.

Court finds defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program but IS eligible for the WI Substance Abuse program.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied.
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Matter before the Court for Calendar call/Sentencing hearing.  Defense reports that the defendant is in custody at the Milwaukee Secure Detention Center.  The Court orders stayed warrant vacated at this time.  Hearing rescheduled with the parties.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Matter calendared for Sentencing on today.  Defendant not present in court.  Defense motion for stayed bench warrant heard and granted.  The Court orders Bench Warrant to Issue but Stayed until 6-26-15 at 1:30 p.m.   Case set for Sentencing on 6-26-15 at 1:30 p.m. before Branch 15.
Justice Point Pretrial Report, received and filed.

Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
On motion of the State, Court ordered the "Second and Subsequent" enhancer dismissed.
  Defendant  advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms; also defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
Case calendared for SENTENCING on 6/25/2015 at 1:30 pm in Branch 15.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 06-25-2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Report received and filed. sab

Attorney Alexis Liggins in court, defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski not in court, in custody.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense motion for modification of bail heard and granted.  Court modifies bail to a $250 signature bond, vacating the TOT to Justice Point and modifying it to a referral to Justice Point.  Justice Point can determine level of supervision needed.  Status conference scheduled for April 14, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in custody.  Ron Dague for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  sc  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Darrin Joseph Jarentowski in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm

Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
